main event: Two star-like objects were observed in 2D ground-visual sighting over Rivera, California on 15th May 1954. The objects climbed steadily, accelerated rapidly, and flew side by side for several minutes. Two B-26s were in the area at the same time.
interesting points: The objects were described as star-like and made no sound.
They climbed steadily and then accelerated rapidly, flying side by side for several minutes.
Two B-26s were in the area at the same time, indicating potential military interest or investigation.
The conclusion of the observation was 'Unknown' as it was not confirmed to be a balloon, aircraft, or astronomical object.
Observers were star gazing at the time of the sighting, providing credibility to the report.
